member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.ScriptParameter.Request(Outpost31.Core.Session.TngnWbsvSession)
member.summary: Processes a request based on the parameters provided in the specified session.
member.remarks: The method determines the type of request by analyzing the property and delegates the processing to the appropriate handler. Supported request types include prototype requests, admin requests, and form access requests. If the request type is unrecognized, a default response is returned.
member.param: The session object containing the request parameters and runtime settings. This parameter cannot be null.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects
member.summary: The data structure that is used to pass information between Avatar and the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
The OptionObjects class contains the logic for managing OptionObjects, which
contain all of the content and metadata of the Avatar form that is sent to
the Tingen Web Service.

There are three types of OptionObjects:
SentOptObj
WorkOptObj
ReturnOptObj

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.SentOptObj
member.summary: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.
member.remarks: This is never modified during a Tingen Web Service session.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.WorkOptObj
member.summary: Where OptionObject work is done.
member.remarks: This object is potentially modified during a Tingen Web Service session.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ReturnOptObj
member.summary: The OptionObject that is returned to Avatar.
member.remarks: This is the finalized WorkOptObj, ready to be returned to Avatar.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ExeAsm
member.summary: The executing Assembly name.
member.remarks: A required component for writing log files, defined here so it can be used throughout the class.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.Finalize(Outpost31.Core.Session.TngnWbsvSession,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Finalize an OptionObject so it can be returned to Avatar.
member.param: The Tingen Session data structure object.
The OptionObject Error Code.
The OptionObject error message.

remarks.note:
Before an OptionObject can be returned to Avatar, we need to make sure
that all of the required OptionObject components exist and/or are
modified correctly.
This is done by calling the OptionObject's built
in ToReturnOptionObject() method on the OptionObject, then
sending it back to Avatar.
remarks.para:
Error Codes
When an OptionObject is returned to Avatar, it requires one of the following
single-digit integer Error Codes:
Error Code Description
0 No action taken
1
Returns an Error Message with an "Ok" button, and stops
further processing of scripts
2
Returns an Error Message with "OK" and "Cancel" buttons,
and stops further scripts the user clicks "Cancel")
3 Returns an Error Message with "Ok" button
4
Returns an Error Message with "Yes" and "No" buttons
and stops further scripts the user clicks "No")
5 Returns a URL to be opened in a new browser
6 Returns a form to be opened in Avatar
remarks.note:
The most common error codes are:
1
Used when you don't want the user to take an action, such as
submitting a form
3 Used when you would like to notify the user of something
4
Used when you want warn the user they may want to make
changes, and give them the option to stop further processing,
or continuing
remarks.para: Please see the class documentation for more information about Error Codes.

member.summary: Debug logs are used when developing the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
Debug logs should be commented out in production code, or removed
if they are not needed.

Syntax:
TODO: Add syntax here.

member.param: The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service has interfaced with.
The name of the assembly generating the log entry.
The full path of the file being logged.
The name of the method being logged.
The line number being logged.
The log message, which defaults to "Debug log." if not specified.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.LogEvent.Debuggler(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Debuggler logs are temporary logs used when you want to debug something specific.

remarks.para:
Debug logs should removed before deploying to production.
Since debuggler logs may be written very quickly, there is a 1000ms delay
before committing to file.

Syntax:
LogEvent.Debuggler(wbsvEnvironment, "Your message here.");

member.param: The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service has interfaced with.
The log message, which defaults to "Debuggler log." if not specified.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.LogEvent.Primeval(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Primeval logs are used where other logs cannot.

remarks.para:
Primeval logs should removed before deploying to production.
Since debuggler logs may be written very quickly, there is a 1000ms delay
before committing to file.

Syntax:
LogEvent.Debuggler(wbsvEnvironment, "Your message here.");

member.param: The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service has interfaced with.
The log message, which defaults to "Primeval log." if not specified.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.LogEvent.Trace(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Trace Logs are used for debugging and tracking the flow of the application.

remarks.para:
Trace logs work a little differently than other logs. They are assigned a "TraceLevel" between 0 and 9,
which is defined in Tingen_Data\WebService\%avtrEnv%\Config\Runtime\TngnWbsv.config:
0 - None
1 - Methods
2 - Conditional statements
9 - All

Each TraceLevel is cumulative, so if you set the level to "5", it will also include all logs
from TraceLevels 1-4. Care should be taken to not set the level too high in production, since
it can impact performance and generate a large amount of log files.
As long as the web service is functioning as expected, the TraceLevel should be set to "0"
Since the TraceLevel handles what Trace Logs are written, Trace Log statements should not be
commented out of production code.

Syntax:
TODO: Add syntax here.

member.param: The Trace Log level.
The Avatar environment that interfaces with the Tingen Web Service.
The name of the assembly generating the trace.
The full path of the file being logged.
The name of the method being logged.
The line number being logged.
The message to include in the trace log. Defaults to "No message." if not specified.

member.summary: Writes log content to a local file.
member.param: A dictionary containing the file path and log content. The key "FullPath" specifies the full path to the file, and the key "LogContent" specifies the content to be written.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Runtime.TngnWbsvRuntimeSettings.New(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the RuntimeSettings class.
member.returns: An object containing the runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para: This method sets all runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.

The following runtime settings are loaded from external files:
tngnWbsvEnv
The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.
This value is stored in the .\AppData\Runtime\TngnWbsv.Env file,
and must be a valid Avatar environment.
If this file does not exist, the Tingen Web Service will not start.
tngnWbsvEnvDataPath
The path on the machine that hosts the Tingen Web Service, where all data
required by the Tingen Web Service will be stored. This is per-environment,
and the first part of this path is hardcoded as C:\Tingen_Data\, so
the directory must exist on the hosts machine.
tngnWbsvMode
The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.
This value is stored in the .\AppData\Runtime\TngnWbsv.Env file,
and must be a valid Avatar environment.
If this file does not exist, the Tingen Web Service will not start.

In addition to the above, this method also sets the Tingen Web Service build number,
which is in YYMMDD format. This value must be updated whenever the Tingen Web Service
is deployed to the host machine.

The TngnWbsvSession object contains:
The TngnWbsvConfig object All runtime and external configuration information
OptionObjects All necessary OptionObjects
The Scriptlink Script Parameter The Script Parameter sent from Avatar that contains the request
